Key Match Events: Criswell retired the first 12 Tigers he faced, needing just 52 pitches to get there.
Spencer Torkelson hit a go-ahead two-run homer on a hanging curveball by Hill in the bottom of the fifth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Red Sox manager Alex Cora planned to bring on lefty Rich Hill to start the bottom of the fifth inning due to a large number of left-handed batters facing Criswell.
Post-Match Reflections: Rich Hill acknowledged the poorly executed curveball to Torkelson as a mistake that cost the team the game.
The loss dropped the Red Sox 4 1/2 games back in the AL Wild Card standings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox struggled at the plate over the last 10 games with a batting average of.205/.246/.357 and scoring 2.9 runs per game.
